Articles.Content:
I've made a few Photoshop manipulations of some of the screenshots I've taken, as a form of practice. My use of programs (3d programs, photoshop, etc.) is very hectic and disorganised, so I don't have much technical knowledge, only intuition and hands-on knowledge. However, I think I've made some good stuff regardless. At the very least, I don't think they'll make you gouge your eyes out.

Album of my stuff so far (with descriptions for each image):



 

Edited November 30, 2015 by TyrannoFan
Fixing formatting
And here I am, stunned by the beauty of these.
Wow impressive, That moon shot looks very semi-realistic, and that ion glow on the first picture... lovley

Thanks for the compliments! For comparison's sake, here's the original screenshots (although, original Ion craft screenshot is lost and there isn't a single screenshot for the Voyager image):

 

Edited November 30, 2015 by TyrannoFan
Formatting

So I've decided I'll be doing a bunch of images along the same vein as the Mun landing image. Quality may vary, largely due to the strangeness of some of KSP's planets. Here's Minmus:

Spoiler



This one was a bit difficult since Minmus is really strange. After some short research, my best guess is it's made of some sort of copper salt. So, I used an image of salt flats for the environment, and Apollo images of the Lunar landscape for the hills.

Edited November 30, 2015 by TyrannoFan
Formatting

I've made a new image. This time, it's a small probe-powered science lab called Akatsuki taking an image of my recently deployed Kōkishin rover:

Spoiler
Those are really great images, mate. I particularly liked the "little green men" one. Gave me a real feeling of vastness and scope.
